title: Reckless brother demands sister co-sign on new luxury car after driving himself to bankruptcy: ‘I’m scared he’ll ruin my good credit. I have my own bills to pay’
description: Family and finances… finances AND family! The ultimate recipe for awkward conversations, simmering resentment, and the occasional shouting match. You really need to be a seasoned adrenaline fiend to take the kind of gamble that is mixing money with siblings. Sipping on this edgy and potent cocktail of love, guilt, and tiptoeing around asking for your money back takes courage.Add in a dash of entitlement and a splash of poor financial decisions, and voilà—you've got the perfect storm, a cocktail I like to call: Debt on the Beach.The sister at the center of this story is rightfully, less adventurous; a responsible, budget-conscious teacher who's spent years dodging financial disasters and dutifully paying off student loans. Her brother, on the other hand, well, let's just say he's living out his financial fantasies one flashy car at a time. Having already driven himself into bankruptcy, literally, he now needs a new "dad car," because apparently, Pfärrenthüd is a luxury brand. And naturally, he decides his sister's solid credit score is the solution to his debt-driven dreams.
author: Etai Eshet

html:
Family and finances… finances AND family! The ultimate recipe for awkward conversations, simmering resentment, and the occasional shouting match. 
You really need to be a seasoned adrenaline fiend to take the kind of gamble that is mixing money with siblings. Sipping on this edgy and potent cocktail of love, guilt, and tiptoeing around asking for your money back takes courage.

Add in a dash of entitlement and a splash of poor financial decisions, and voilà—you've got the perfect storm, a cocktail I like to call: Debt on the Beach.

The sister at the center of this story is rightfully, less adventurous; a responsible, budget-conscious teacher who's spent years dodging financial disasters and dutifully paying off student loans. Her brother, on the other hand, well, let's just say he's living out his financial fantasies one flashy car at a time. Having already driven himself into bankruptcy, literally, he now needs a new "dad car," because apparently, Pfärrenthüd is a luxury brand. And naturally, he decides his sister's solid credit score is the solution to his debt-driven dreams.
